page.title: 07Religion Adulam Baptism (2)
page.content: Tragedy at Lliedi Baptism Service fifth of September 1959.Hundreds of people lining the baptismal pool of the River Lliedi at Felinfoel on Sunday morning saw the Rev.J.Glyndwr Davies,minister of Adulam Chapel, collapse as he was conducting the service waist deep in the river. He died shortly afterwards in a nearby house. Friends of the 51-year old minister had tried to persuade him to get another minister to help at that Sunday's open_air service.Onlookers saw Mr.Davies baptise five of the 10 young candidates,then collapse as TV cameras filmed the scene. Four deacons of the chapel carried him unconscious from the pool into a house nearby. There he died before the arrival of a doctor. A fortnight later it was the 250th Anniversary of Adulam Llanelli's oldest Nonconformist church.
